newsitem.title: RUSSIA: SOCCER-ALANIA VLADIKAVKAZ DEFENDER BANNED FOR 10 GAMES.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-ALANIA VLADIKAVKAZ DEFENDER BANNED FOR 10 GAMES.

text.p: Defender Sergei Timofeyev, who plays for Russian champions Alania Vladikavkaz, has been banned for 10 games for breaking an opponent's cheekbone with his elbow.
Timofeyev was originally suspended for an unlimited period after he elbowed Lokomotiv Moscow's Andrei Solomatin during a 0-0 draw in September.

A Russian soccer official said on Wednesday the league's disciplinary committee had decided to limit the punishment to a 10-game ban after hearing evidence that Solomatin was recovering faster than expected.
Timofeyev, who has already been sidelined for three games, will miss the vital final two games of the season and the first five matches of the next term.

Alania's chances of retaining the championship suffered a big blow earlier this month when international defender Omari Tetradze was suspended for the rest of the season for pushing a linesman during a 2-0 away defeat by CSKA Moscow.
Alania, who have always had a reputation for physical play, are on 66 points with two games of the season left. Above them are Rotor Volgograd with 67 and Spartak Moscow on 68.
